articles.headline: Strategy of New Chief at Motorola Appears Poised to Pay Off
articles.snippet: When Sanjay Jha took over as Motorola’s new co-chief executive, he went in search of a great new phone idea inside the company.
articles.abstract: When Sanjay Jha took over as Motorola’s new co-chief executive, he went in search of a great new phone idea inside the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: LIBERTYVILLE, Ill. Sanjay Jha’s honeymoon as co-chief executive at Motorola lasted just a few minutes into his first meeting with employees in 2008.

articles.headline: New Models From Motorola, HTC and BlackBerry
articles.snippet: All three companies are back with much more impressive, much more refined new smartphones.
articles.abstract: All three companies are back with much more impressive, much more refined new smartphones.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ever notice how many bits of common wisdom actually contradict each other? I mean, haste makes waste  yet the early bird gets the worm. There are no second acts in American lives  but if at first you don’t succeed, try, try again.

articles.headline: With Video, a Traveler Fights Back
articles.snippet: A singer, whose career was boosted by his music video on YouTube about baggage handlers at United breaking his guitar, had his luggage temporarily lost by the airline on a trip to speak to executives about customer service.
articles.abstract: A singer, whose career was boosted by his music video on YouTube about baggage handlers at United breaking his guitar, had his luggage temporarily lost by the airline on a trip to speak to executives about customer service.
articles.lead_paragraph: United Airlines learned its lesson the hard way that David Carroll was not just another customer.

articles.headline: 3rd Rescue Considered for GMAC
articles.snippet: The auto financing company’s failure, some experts say, could threaten any recovery in the car industry.
articles.abstract: The auto financing company’s failure, some experts say, could threaten any recovery in the car industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: It might seem like a lot of cash for one supersize clunker, a good-money-after-bad attempt to jump-start a broken-down giant of Detroit.

articles.headline: Loosening of F.B.I. Rules Stirs Privacy Concerns
articles.snippet: The disclosure of the bureau’s operations manual opens a window onto new powers that agents have been given.
articles.abstract: The disclosure of the bureau’s operations manual opens a window onto new powers that agents have been given.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  After a Somali-American teenager from Minneapolis committed a suicide bombing in Africa in October 2008, the Federal Bureau of Investigation began investigating whether a Somali Islamist group had recruited him on United States soil.

articles.headline: Not Running Against Wall St.
articles.snippet: Eric R. Dinallo, the former right-hand man of New York’s attorney general, running for the office himself, has gained some unexpected backers.
articles.abstract: Eric R. Dinallo, the former right-hand man of New York’s attorney general, running for the office himself, has gained some unexpected backers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eric R. Dinallo was once one of Eliot Spitzer’s right-hand men.

articles.headline: Tehran Rejects Nuclear Accord, Officials Report
articles.snippet: Iran has refused to go along with a plan to send its uranium out of the country, U.S. officials said.
articles.abstract: Iran has refused to go along with a plan to send its uranium out of the country, U.S. officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is by David E. Sanger, Steven Erlanger and Robert F. Worth.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger, Steven Erlanger and Robert F. Worth

articles.headline: U.S. Economy Began to Grow Again in 3rd Quarter
articles.snippet: Output of goods and services grew at a 3.5 percent annual rate, but it will be months before job-seekers feel a change.
articles.abstract: Output of goods and services grew at a 3.5 percent annual rate, but it will be months before job-seekers feel a change.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States has emerged from the longest economic contraction since World War II.
